intro: Tephroseris integrifolia subsp. aurantiaca, commonly known as the red-flowered tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its striking orange to red flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its vibrant, showy inflorescences and its ability to thrive in well-drained, sandy soils. It typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant's botanical features make it a notable species for both ecological studies and horticultural interest.
